results.title: Safety oriented first aid. Unit 2
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional first aid films. Explains the symptoms of shock, its causes and treatment. Shows fractures and dislocations; how they occur, and their treatment. Narrated by John Granik.
results.description: One of a series of instructional first aid films. Explains the symptoms of shock, its causes and treatment. Shows fractures and dislocations; how they occur, and their treatment. Narrated by John Granik.

results.title: Safety in the shop: power tools
results.brief_description: Stresses common sense practices in the use of woodworking and metal working machines, including the drill press, grinder, jointer, router and various types of power saws and lathes. Shows the need for proper clothing, machine guards, making adjustments before starting the machine, dealing with broken blades and the value of neatness.

results.title: Safety in the shop: basic practices
results.brief_description: This film emphasises the worker’s responsibility for safety in both wood and metal shops in clothing, lifting and carrying. Important also are the values of tidiness and the taking of adequate precautions in fire prevention.

results.title: Safety in the shop
results.brief_description: Stresses the responsibility of the supervisor in teaching and maintaining safe practices. Three typical accidents are shown and then the causes are analysed. Poor supervision and inadequate training are shown as contributing factors.

results.title: Safety in the mountains: snowcraft
results.creator_credit: John Cooper, Grahame MacFarlane and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Outlines the major points to remember in mountain craft; the preliminary climb and how and when to use the rope; climbing on soft snow and hard snow, step-cutting, use of crampons and general uphill and downhill movement.

results.title: Safety in the mountains: bushcraft
results.creator_credit: John Cooper, Grahame MacFarlane and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The organisation of a bushwalking trip, showing the choice of equipment and its packing, food and clothing, ways to cross a river, building fires, marking a trail, handling firearms and other examples of bushcraft.

results.title: Safety in the home. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: H William Varney, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates through a series of brief incidents, the importance of making common sense “decisions of safety” to prevent household mishaps. Includes test situations for children to make correct choices.

results.title: Safety in the home. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the most common safety hazards in the home and how they can be corrected. The film is centred round the story of how a child’s negligence in putting away her toys causes an accident which injures her mother. The incident leads to a thorough check of the household and the removal of other danger spots.
